title: Eleanor Davis - How To Be Happy
description:
How To Be Happy

Fantagraphics, 2014, 151 pages

Written and Illustrated by Eleanor Davis

Eleanor Davis's How to Be Happy is the artist's first collection of graphic/literary short stories, and itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s about time. Davis is one of the finest cartoonists of her generation, and has been producing comics since the mid-2000s. Happy represents the best stories she's drawn for such connoisseurial venues as Mome, Nobrow, and Lucky Peach, as well as her own self-publishing and web efforts. Davis achieves a rare, subtle poignancy in her narratives that are at once compelling and elusive, pregnant with mystery and a deeply satisfying emotional resonance. Happy shows the full range of Davis's graphic skills Ã¢â‚¬â€ sketchy drawing, polished pen-and-ink line work, and meticulously designed full-color painted panels Ã¢â‚¬â€ which are always in the service of a narrative that builds to a quietly devastating climax
